extraction of metals involves :
1. {{c1::Oxidation(converting to oxide form)}}
2. {{c1::Reduction to metal}}
C reduction of metal oxides :
\(\mathrm{M}_{\mathrm{x}} \mathrm{O}_{\mathrm{y}}+\mathrm{yC} \rightarrow \mathrm{xM}+\mathrm{y} \mathrm{CO}\)
Ellingham diagram shows graphs of ฮG of {{c1::oxid<sup>n</sup>}} of metals
sudden changes in \(\Delta_{r} G^{\ominus}\) in the ellignham diagram signifies {{c1::state change}}

IN ellignham diagram :
If a metal1's line is below metal2's line, then 

metal 1 is {{c1::reduced}} by metal2

if lower, it has lesser \(\Delta_{r} G^{\ominus}\)

hence we get \(\Delta_{r} G^{\ominus}{net}\) = very (-ve) + small(+ve)

Limitations of Ellignham diagram includes :
1. shows only {{c1::feasibility}} not {{c1::practicality}} of a reaction
2. uses only \(\Delta_{r} G^{\ominus}\) and not \(\Delta_{r} G^{}\) and not all reactions are in equlibrium conditions

\(\Delta_{r} G^{\ominus}\) is ฮG @ eqm

practicality here means, speed and kinetic things

reduction methods : 
1. {{c2::smelting(C-reduction)}}[higher reactive]
2. {{c2::H2 reduction}}[higher reactive]
3. {{c1::self/auto-reduction}}[lesser reactive]
4. {{c1::other metals(metals used as reagent are reactive)}}[lesser reactive]

5. e-reduction[very reactive metals]
6. leaching
{{c1::E-reduction}} is used to extract highly reactive metals like Na, Al, K from ore

In a blast furnance :
a blast of hot air is sent โ from the bottom by burning {{c1::coke[C(l)]}}
which gives temps upto {{c1::2200K}}

After Coke burn @ bottom of blast furnace :
heat + {{c1::CO::gas}} move up

{{c2::upper}} parts of a blast furnace, temp is {{c2::lower}} where
{{c1::\(\ce{Fe2O3}\)}} and {{c1::\(\ce{Fe3O4}\)}} get {{c2::reduced}} to {{c1::FeO}}
image 2 website lienk

Blast furnace upper realm reactions(500-800K)

Reacn 1. 3\(\ce{Fe2O3}\) + CO โ 2{{c1::\(\ce{Fe3O4}\)}}  + CO2
Reacn 2. \(\ce{Fe3O4}\) + 4CO โ 3{{c1::Fe}} + 4CO2
Reacn 3. \(\ce{Fe2O3}\) + CO โ 2{{c1::FeO}} + CO2

FeO reduced at bottom by CO

steps are in the order of reactions
In a blast furnance {{c2::\(\ce{Fe2O3}\)}} is first reduced to {{c1::\(\ce{Fe3O4}\)}} and {{c1::\(\ce{FeO}\)}}

Limestone decomposes to {{c1::CaO}} in blast furnace and
helps remove {{c1::Silicate(\(\ce{SiOx}\))}} impurities as slag{{c1::(\(\ce{CaSiO3}\))::formula}}

Finally in the blast furnace:
the {{c2::FeO::compound}} formed due to {{c1::\(\ce{Fe2O3}\)}} {{c2::redn ::process}} is reduced to Fe by {{c1::C}}
Iron finally melts at bottom and is collected to form {{c1::pig}} iron
pig iron contains {{c1::4}}% C and {{c1::many::amount1}} impurities
Cast iron contains {{c1::3}}% C and is {{c1::hard::hardness}} + {{c1::brittle::flexi-ness}}

Cast iron is prepared by :
melting pig iron with {{c1::scrap}} iron & {{c1::coke}}
with a {{c1::hot air blast::heating method}}

{{c1::Wrought}} iron or {{c2::malleable}} iron is the {{c2::purest}} form
of commercial iron
Cu-matte contains {{c1::Cu<sub>2</sub>S}} and {{c1::FeS}}

Cu extraction reactions : 

1. Oxidantion of FeS \(\ce{=>}\) 2FeS + 3O2 โ 2FeO + 2SO2

2. Slag formation \(\ce{=>}\) FeO + SiO2 โ FeSiO3

3. 2Cu2S + 3O2 โ 2{{c1::Cu2O}} + 2{{c1::SO2}} 

4. Self reduction(full reaction) \(\ce{=>}\){{c2::2Cu2O + Cu2S โ 6Cu + SO2 }}

The solidified copper obtained has {{c3::blistered}} appearance due to the
evolution of {{c1::SO<sub>2</sub>}} and so it is called {{c2::blister Cu}}
as SO2 bubbles away it makes weird shit on the surface

In Hall-herhoult process to refine Al eletrolytically : 
purified {{c1::Al2O3}} + {{c2::Na3AlF6::added to reduce MP}} + {{c2::CaF2::to increase conductivity}}
are fused
The fused mixture(in hall-herhoult) is electrolysed in a {{c1::steel}} vessel lined with {{c1::C}}
In hall-herhoult process, the liberated O<sub>2</sub> reacts with {{c1::C electrodes}}, {{c2::burning}} it away
the eletrolysis itself is called hall-herhoult

Hall-herhoult
Cathode :
{{c1::\(\ce{Al^3+(melt) + 3eโ โ Al(l)}\)::CNR}}

Anode(ANOde) : 
{{c2::\(\ce{C(s) + O^2โ}\)}}(melt) โ {{c2::CO}}(g) + \(\ce{2eโ}\) 
{{c2::\(\ce{C(s) + 2O^2โ}\)}}(melt) โ {{c2::CO2}} (g) + \(\ce{4eโ}\)
the eletrolysis itself is called hall-herhoult

Cu extraction from scraps

1. {{c2::leach}} with {{c1::acid/bacteria }}
2. treat solution containing {{c2::\(\ce{Cu^2+}\)}} with {{c1::scrap iron/H2}}
